body.p: A researcher looks at the mean salaries of male and female electricians and decides based on the evidence that there is no difference between the two groups. Given that there was a failure to reject the null hypothesis, it is possible that a type II error was made.
Given the type of error made in this situation, what could researchers do to reduce the risk of this error?

multiple_choice.choice: Choose a .01 significance level, instead of a .05 significance level.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Choosing a smaller significance level will decrease the chance of a type I error, because it will make it more difficult to reject the null hypothesis. As this is a type II error, the best approach would be to increase the sample size.
Correct. Increasing the sample size is the best way to reduce the likelihood of a type II error.

body.p: Which of the following statements is true regarding reducing the likelihood of type I and type II errors?

multiple_choice.choice: Both error types can be reduced by increasing the sample size.
Both error types can be reduced by choosing a smaller significance level α.
Both error types can be reduced by choosing a larger significance level α.
Both error types cannot be reduced simultaneously.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Increasing the sample size only reduces the chance of type II error, and actually increases the chance of type I error.
Incorrect. Choosing a smaller significance level only reduces the chance of type I error and actually increases the chance of type II error.
Incorrect. Choosing a larger significance level only reduces the chance of type II error and actually increases the chance of type I error.

Correct. Increasing the sample size decreases the change of type II error but increases the chance of type I error. Choosing a smaller significance level reduces the chance of type I error but increases the chance of type II error.
